doc.after: Basel (/ËbÉËzÉl/ or /ËbÉËl/; or less often used Basle;[3] German: Basel pronounced [ËbaËzÉl]; French: BÃ¢le [bÉl]; Italian: Basilea [baziËlÉËa]; Romansh: Basilea [baziËlÉËa]) is Switzerland's third most populous city (behind ZÃ¼rich and Geneva) with about 195,000 inhabitants.[4] Located where the Swiss, French and German borders meet, Basel also has suburbs in France and Germany. In 2011, the Basel agglomeration was the third largest in Switzerland with a population of 500,600[5] in 74 municipalities in Switzerland and an additional 53 in neighboring countries (municipal count as of 2000).[6] The tri-national Basel metropolitan area has around 830,000 inhabitants in 226 municipalities.[7]
